bibl.title: State of Nebraska Department of Insurance

body.seg: State of Nebraska DEPARTMENT OF INSURANCE Summary of Insurance Business in Nebraska for .the Year 1939 Also Comparative Figures of Authorized Companies for the years 1936, 1937, 1938.

To His Eixellency, Governor R. L. Cochran: We respectfully submit the summary of business of companies authorized to write Insurance in this State for the year ending December 31, 1939. DEPARTMENT OF INSURANCE, C. SMEHA, Director.

ENGLAND M, V \^ {T \ ° I HOLLAND '\\, -V V SCOTLAND 4 \ SWITZERLAND 2 \^ \^ . - ' | Zones shown arc [or purpose of Convention Examinations. Light face figures in respective State indicates Nebraska Companies writing in that state. Bold face figures in respective State indicates Companies domiciled in that State writing in Nebraska. Where but one figure appears indicates Nebraska Companies writing in that State. 27 Nebraska Companies write in other States. Figures in map compiled as of July IS, 1940.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT COMPANIES ORGANIZED IN NEBRASKA FROM JANUARY 1, 1039 TO JUNE 1, 1040 Associated Hospital Service of Nebraska (Assessment Health & Acci - dent) 402-3 Omaha National Bank Bldg., Omaha, Nebraska Licensed January 30, 1939, to write: Hospltalization resulting from bodily injuries or sickness and every insurance pertaining thereto. Mammoth Casualty Company (Assessment Casualty) 319 Terminal Building Lincoln, Nebraska Licensed September 1, 1939, to write: Accident and Health. National Finance Health & Accident Association (Assessment Casualty) City National Bank Building Omaha, Nebraska Licensed June 13, 1939, to write: Accident and Health. National Indemnity Company (Stock Casualty) 558 Brandeis Theatre Building Omaha, Nebraska Licensed May 1, 1940, to write: Full Coverage Automobile. United Limited Life Company (Stock Burial) Insurance Bldg., Lincoln, Nebraska Licensed January 4, 1939 to write: Burial Benefits.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT FOREIGN AND ALIEN COMPANIES ADMITTED TO NEBRASKA FROM JANUARY 1, 1089 TO JUNE 1, 1940 Allied Mutual Casualty Company (Assessment Casualty) Dcs Moines, lowa Admitted August 4,1939 to write: Full Coverage Automobile. American Guarantee and Liability Insurance Company (Stock Casualty) 80 John Street New York, N. Y. Mail Address: 135 So. LaSalle St., Chicago, 111. Admitted November 10,1939, to write: Accident, Health, Fidelity, Surety, Liability, Workmen's Com - pensation, Plate Glass, Boiler & Machinery, Burglary, Sprinkler . Leakage, Automobile, Engine and Elevator. American National Insurance Company (Stock Life) 21st and Aved Streets Galveston, Texas Admitted July 18, 1939, to write: Life. Badger Mutual Fire Insurance Company (Mutual Fire) 1635 West National Avenue Milwaukee, Wisconsin Admitted March 11, 1940 to write: Fire and Allied Lines as provided in Section 44-401, Nebraska Compiled Statutes. Calvert Fire Insurance Company (Stock Fire) 401 Walnut Street Philadelphia, Pa. Mail Address: First National Bank Bldg., Baltimore, Md. Admitted April 9,1940, to write: Fire and Allied Lines, including Full Coverage Automobile. Dearborn Nationallnsurance Company (Stock Fire) 154 Bagley Avenue Detroit, Michigan Admitted January 10, 1940, to write: . ¦ Fire, Automobile and Inland Marine. Emmco Casualty Insurance Company, Inc. Employers Mutual Fire Insurance Company (Mutual Fire) 502 Third Street Wausau, Wisconsin Admitted April 16, 1940, to write: Fire and Marine. .

Admitted January 17, 1940, to write: Fire, Ocean Marine, Motor Vehicle, Earthquake, Inland Marine, Tornado, Hail, Sprinkler Leakage, Riot, Civil Commotion and Explosion, Damage to Property by Aircraft or Motor Vehicle. Motor Indemnity Association (Reciprocal Casualty) 20 5 West Jefferson Street South Bend, Indiana Admitted March 6, 1939, to write: Full Coverage Automobile. NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT COMPANIES REINSURING, MERGING, OR WITHDRAWING FROM JANUARY 1, 1039 TO JUNE 1, 1040 Allemannia Fire Insurance Company of Pittsburg, Pittsburgh, Pa., with - drew as of April 30, 1939. Bankers National Life Insurance Company, Montclair, New Jersey, withdrew as of April 30, 1939. Boyd County Farmers' Mutual Assessment Association, Anoka, Nebras - ka, dissolved by action of the Board of Directors in 1940. Central States Life Insurance Company, St. Louis, Missouri, withdrew as of December 31, 1939. Farmers Mutual Fire and Lightning Insurance Company of Burt County, Tekamah, Nebraska, dissolved by Board of Directors In May,-1940. Farmers Mutual Insurance Company of Hamilton County, Aurora, Ne - braska, ceased business in January, 1937, and filed certificate of dissolution February 13, 1939. First American Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, liquidation or - dered in District Court of Lancaster County, Nebraska, June 19, 1940. First Reinsurance Company of Hartford, Hartford, Connecticut, with - drew as of January 1, 1939. Great Western Fire Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, dissolved on application of company by Order of District Court November 9, 1939. Guaranty Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, is dormant. Interstate Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, order of liquidation entered by District Court June 26, 1940. Merchants Insurance Company of Province, Rhode Island, reinsured by Rhode Island Insurance Company, Providence, Rhode Island, De - cember 31, 1939. National Accident Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, liquidated and dissolved as of May 13, 1940 National Petroleum Mutual Fire Insurance Company, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, reinsured by Western Millers Mutual Fire Insurance Company, Kansas City, Missouri, November 21, 1939. Nebraska Hail Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, is dormant. Pawnee County Mutual Insurance Company, Pawnee City, Nebraska, reinsured by Farmers Union Co-Operative Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, April 3, 1939. United Crop Growers Hail Insurance Company, Grand Island, Nebraska, is dormant. Western Casualty Company, Chicago, Illinois, withdrew as of January 1, 1940. Western Underwriters Mutual Insurance Company, Kansas City, Miss - ouri, reinsured by Union Mutual Fire Insurance Company, Provi - dence, Rhode Island, September 1, 1939. Wheat Belt Hail Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, is dormant.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT COMPANIES CHANGING NAME OR PLAN FROM JANUARY 1, 1089 TO JUNE 1, 1940 Allied Mutual Automobile Association, Dcs Moines, lowa, changed name to Allied Mutual Casualty Company, January 30, 1940. Columbia Insurance Company, Jersey City, New Jersey, changed name j tb Columbia Insurance Company of New York, and reincorporated i a^ a New York corporation, April 4,1939. Dwelling House Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, changed name to Standard Reliance Insurance Company, January 30, 1939. The Excess Insurance Company of America, Jersey City, New Jersey, was j reinsured November 24, 1939, by a new company of the same name incorporated in New York. Grange and Farmers Mutual Insurance Company of Washington and ; Burt Counties, Blair, Nebraska, changed name to Grange and Farm - ¦¦; ers Insurance Company, March 7,1940. Great American Health and Accident Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, j changed name to American Protective Health and Accident Com - pany, February 14, 1939. Saint Paul-Mercury Indemnity Company of Saint Paul, Wilmington, j Delaware, changed name to Saint Paul-Mercury Indemnity Com - pany, January 26,1939.
